metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SQL CHECK Constraint
SQL CHECK Constraint
The CHECK constraint is used to limit the value range that can be placed in a column.
content.html: The CHECK constraint is used to limit the value range that can be placed in a column.

content.text: If you define a CHECK constraint on a column it will allow only certain values for this column.
content.html: If you define a CHECK constraint on a column it will allow only certain values for this column.

content.text: If you define a CHECK constraint on a table it can limit the values in certain columns based on values in other columns in the row.
content.html: If you define a CHECK constraint on a table it can limit the values in certain columns based on values in other columns in the row.

content.text: SQL CHECK on CREATE TABLE
The following SQL creates a CHECK constraint on the "Age" column when the "Persons" table is created. The CHECK constraint ensures that the age of a person must be 18, or older:
content.html: The following SQL creates a CHECK constraint on the "Age" column when the "Persons" table is created. The CHECK constraint ensures that the age of a person must be 18, or older:

content.text: MySQL:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int,
   
CHECK (Age>=18)
);

content.code:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
ID int NOT NULL,

LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,

FirstName varchar(255),

Age int,

CHECK (Age>=18)
);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,

FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int,
   
CHECK (Age>=18)
);

content.code_html:

    Age int,
    CHECK (Age>=18)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),

content.text: SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int CHECK (Age>=18)
);

content.code:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
ID int NOT NULL,

LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,

FirstName varchar(255),

Age int CHECK (Age>=18)
);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int CHECK (Age>=18)
);

content.code_html:
CREATE TABLE Persons (
    ID int NOT NULL,
    LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    FirstName varchar(255),
    Age int CHECK (Age>=18)
);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int CHECK (Age>=18)
);

content.text: To allow naming of a CHECK constraint, and for defining a CHECK constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:
content.html: To allow naming of a CHECK constraint, and for defining a CHECK constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int,
   
City varchar(255),
   
CONSTRAINT CHK_Person CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes')
);

content.code:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
ID int NOT NULL,

LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,

FirstName varchar(255),

Age int,

City varchar(255),

CONSTRAINT CHK_Person CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes')
);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int,
   
City varchar(255),
   
CONSTRAINT CHK_Person CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes')
);

content.code_html:
CREATE TABLE Persons (
    ID int NOT NULL,
    LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    FirstName varchar(255),
    Age int,
    City varchar(255),
    CONSTRAINT CHK_Person CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes')
);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE TABLE Persons
(
    ID int NOT NULL,
   
LastName varchar(255) NOT NULL,
   
FirstName varchar(255),
   
Age int,
   
City varchar(255),
   
CONSTRAINT CHK_Person CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes')
);

content.text: SQL CHECK on ALTER TABLE
To create a CHECK constraint on the "Age" column when the table is already created, use the following SQL:
content.html: To create a CHECK constraint on the "Age" column when the table is already created, use the following SQL:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CHECK (Age>=18);

content.text: To allow naming of a CHECK constraint, and for defining a CHECK constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:
content.html: To allow naming of a CHECK constraint, and for defining a CHECK constraint on multiple columns, use the following SQL syntax:

content.text: MySQL / SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes');

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes');

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes');

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes');

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge CHECK (Age>=18 AND City='Sandnes');

content.text: DROP a CHECK Constraint
To drop a CHECK constraint, use the following SQL:
content.html: To drop a CHECK constraint, use the following SQL:

content.text: SQL Server / Oracle / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CONSTRAINT CHK_PersonAge;

content.text: MySQL:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CHECK CHK_PersonAge;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CHECK CHK_PersonAge;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CHECK CHK_PersonAge;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CHECK CHK_PersonAge;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP CHECK CHK_PersonAge;

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the primary purpose of the SQL CHECK constraint?
content.html: What is the primary purpose of the SQL CHECK constraint?

metadata.question: What is the primary purpose of the SQL CHECK constraint?

options.text: To ensure that a column cannot have NULL values
To enforce unique values in a column
To limit the value range that can be placed in a column
To link a column to a primary key in another table

content.question: What is the primary purpose of the SQL CHECK constraint?

options.text: To ensure that a column cannot have NULL values
To enforce unique values in a column
To limit the value range that can be placed in a column
To link a column to a primary key in another table
